content: Amoxicillin is a first-line antibiotic for dental infections. For adult dental infections, the typical dosage is 500mg three times daily for 7 days. It is effective against most oral pathogens but may be combined with clavulanic acid (Augmentin) for broader coverage when beta-lactamase producing organisms are suspected.
reference: Applied Pharmacology for the Dental Hygienist, 8th Edition
